Her loyalty is unmatched and shows greatly in her dedication to serving the staff and students at Clyde Intermediate. She always has a heart for the underdog and is always looking out for all kids. There is no telling how many lunches she has purchased for students over the years. Thank you Mrs. Jones for your love and the impact you have made at Clyde Intermediate and Clyde CISD.

These Clyde Elementary students have been learning about the power of innovation and creativity by repurposing household items to create something new. What a great lesson for a time when innovation and new ideas and breakthroughs are so important!
.
Scientists believe that we become “encultured” in our routines and habits sometimes making it difficult for us to think differently and creatively!
.
New ideas are so crucial in our world, and it’s so important to learn to think outside our norms. This lesson is an awesome way to encourage new ideas!
.
One day, we look back on this crisis and see that it resulted in lots of new innovations, breakthroughs, ideas and techniques, and that is very exciting to think about!

Each class used clues and quickly guessed the location; They also exchanged fun facts like why the Greenbay Packer fans wear cheese on their heads (because they are known for their dairy farms and cheese!) post_text: The CHS Community Problem Solving team was sent off to state this morning by the staff and students! We are very proud of this team and their commitment to our community! The CMPS team decided to fundraise for a bullet proof vest for our local K-9 unit and to honor the community workers that deal directly with animals. In order to do this, they held hat days once a month, held a booth at our local pecan fest, hosted our third annual Cupcake Wars, posted articles about individual animal workers in our local newspaper, wrote thank you cards at christmas time and held a facebook fundraiser. This team raised a total of $919 to purchase the bullet proof vest and are excited to present it to our police department when it arrives.

This week, we are participating in the hour of code, a global movement to expose students and community to “code” and demystify the field of computer science. While all of us know that it’s important for students to learn how to navigate today’s tech-saturated world, many of us aren’t experienced in computer science and don’t know where to start. 🤷🏻‍♀️🤷🏽‍♂️

Research shows that kids can pick up programming concepts before they know how to read and write! In fact, their brains are more receptive to computer languages at a young age, just like foreign languages.

Hosting the Hour of Code event gives all of us a chance to see what computer science is about! 🤗 #hourofcode2018 Check out this video from last year’s coding event! https://youtu.be/gosNMFkSo7Q

post_text:
On December 4-8, Clyde CISD will be participating in the Hour of Code!! YAY!!!!!!!!!

WHY IS THIS SO EXCITING??

We live in a world surrounded by technology, and we know that whatever field our students choose to go into as adults, their ability to succeed will increasingly depend on understanding how technology works.

HOWEVER, only a tiny fraction of us are learning how technology works.

We want to ensure that our students are on the forefront of creating technology of the future—not just consuming it. By participating in the Hour of Code, Clyde CISD is making a statement that we are ready to teach these foundational 21st-century skills.
